body: /run agent-plugin-test-2
The test fails, please check locally.
@arugal He changed this test, I don't know whether should be rerun.
Do you delete the existing template? This is an ES template parameter. Check `StorageEsInstaller#createTable`

> @arugal He changed this test, I don't know whether should be rerun.

```
[2019-11-05T08:53:23.451Z] start container of testcase.name=apm-toolkit-trace-scenario-1.0.0
[2019-11-05T08:53:23.451Z] Unable to find image 'skywalking/agent-test-jvm:wl2_559' locally
[2019-11-05T08:53:24.037Z] docker: Error response from daemon: pull access denied for skywalking/agent-test-jvm, repository does not exist or may require 'docker login': denied: requested access to the resource is denied.
[2019-11-05T08:53:24.037Z] See 'docker run --help'.
[2019-11-05T08:53:24.037Z] docker startup failure!
```
This is the cause of failure.
/run ci
One reminder for @sxzaihua, the document has not been updated.

> @dmsolr Which workload and group should be added? Or should we start workload 4 for now? @kezhenxu94

Workload4 has been set up, use file name `Jenkinsfile-Agent-Test-4` and ping me, and I'll enable this job,
@kezhenxu94 Hi, I pushed the Jenkinsfile on #3787 . Please review and enable it.
We should maintain a workload list doc in the plugin test doc. Listing all tests, execution time and add recommend group and payload when new user comes.
LGTM
Please update the doc.
A typo for sure. clean is OK because it is not related to test. Yoi could submit another pr to fix this. The PR has been merged.
The refactored Jenkins orchestration should be hopefully available later, and maybe we don't need workload 4

> The refactored Jenkins orchestration should be hopefully available later, and maybe we don't need workload 4

When you are ready, we could switch. @kezhenxu94

Changes in this PR are verified and works for the bug reported.

I have raised a separate PR for RabbitMQ e2e test case migration with package renamed. it is https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3788
Add your job to Jenkinsfile-Agent-Test file, workload 1 group. Otherwise, this would not be tested in CI.
FYI @arugal @aderm
Design doc is here, https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WBnRNF0ABxaSdBZo6Gv2hMzCQzj04YAePUdOyLWHWew/edit#
@heyanlong @kezhenxu94 @dmsolr @arugal @hanahmily @innerpeacez Please review the design doc.
/run agent-plugin-test
It is recommended to replace `sw-cli` with `swctl` or `skywalkingctl`

> It is recommended to replace sw-cli with swctl or skywalkingctl

Left the recommendation or comment to Google doc. It is a better place to share with other reviewers. I will copy the whole final version back to here and mail list.

> Left the recommendation or comment to Google doc. It is a better place to share with other reviewers. I will copy the whole final version back to here and mail list.

Some comments has been added to the document
Hi, you should modify the document in this PR #3783 .
Agree, please move this change inside your PR of feature change.
/run ci
I just updated the design based on @innerpeacez 's review. Subcommands added to make the parameters more clear and easier to extend. Further review is welcome to everyone.
@arugal @kezhenxu94 @dmsolr Please recheck.
LGTM

> The indentation looks odd, mixing spaces and tabs

I will reformat after passed.
/run ci
@TinyAllen Could you take a look? Seem like the last xxx is not working, because of some query logic change.
The topology is based on `IP: port`<->service mapping. Is there anything related to share the same address? Such as some virtual IP?
Your example includes two `c`s in `class_name="ccom.example.demo.controller.TestController"`. Are you sure you set it right?

Not today, if you want that, you need to submit a PR to move it to Agent Config. Like this

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-sniffer/apm-agent-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/agent/core/conf/Config.java#L222
I am not familiar with this framework. one of you can take over this PR.
You need to update https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/Plugin-test.md#the-elapsed-time-list-of-plugins by following the CI result.
@lixiv Have you tried the master? We have a related fix, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/173
@arugal The doc file has been updated, please follow the change.

@viswaramamoorthy The test is not hard, it is just demo codes with the real agent, and check the segments sent by the agent. You should understand it, it will help you to make sure the plugin is right.
@wu-sheng  sorry,in my project  I  used  class_name="com.example.demo.controller.TestController".spring boot version is 2.2.0.RELEASE
Then I will suggest you do debug. You will know whether this class has been enhanced twice.
I will finish this.
If it's not designed like this, I'll try to debug and find the problem

> If it's not designed like this, I'll try to debug and find the problem

It should work. But I am not sure about the real case. This is not the design, but you can invest why.

> @lixiv Have you tried the master? We have a related fix, [apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui#173](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/173)

I just tried the master, the bug still exists.
@lixiv We just fixed it in the UI.

> The topology is based on `IP: port`<->service mapping. Is there anything related to share the same address? Such as some virtual IP?
thanks！  
I  checked our hosts IP，Truly, every host has serveral IPs, One Public IP that Unique, others are private IPs ,such as 192.168.10.2, 192.168.10.7 etc .  And It exsits  that one host has a same private IP as other Host.

If ，like you said , "The topology is based on `IP: port`<->service mapping. " , but there might be a lot of the same private IP in microservices , are  all services associated？

As I mentioned  , our  service "xxx-xxx-api" calls  service "xxx-xxx-wms" use "http://localhost:80/api" , if  we use "http://ip:port/api" (ip is unique private )  to request , will the topology  be normal ?

Yes. Don't use `localhost: port` ever. That will break the topology. The design is based on container-based or micro-service based architecture, so basically, no localhost is being called, all service should be discovered by register center or DNS.

> Yes. Don't use `localhost: port` ever. That will break the topology. The design is based on container-based or micro-service based architecture, so basically, no localhost is being called, all service should be discovered by register center or DNS.

That is , if our  hosts has  only one different unique IP,  but  our service  "xxx-xxx-api" calls service "xxx-xxx-wms" use "http://localhost:80/api" , Is the topology still broken ?  because skywalking Unable to distinguish the api url  from diffrent services between each other.
Yes, that is the right expression.
/run ci
We need to fix async http first. What is status of that ?
Found that httpasyncclient has nothing to do with es6.x plugin, the test samples can pass normally, the only problem is that there may be problems in httpasyncclient.

As aysnc http and es plugin are both default plugin. You must make sure they could work together, that is the default option. So, if anything incompatible in there, should be fixed first. Such as having unexpected exit span or local span with meaningless operation name.
It is easy to delete historical data of ES.

Hi @viswaramamoorthy 
It is almost to be good. follows the reviewer's suggestion and fix them.
Httpasyncclient plugin When the external is exit span, there is no need to perform snapshot delivery. This problem has been solved. Reference #3803 , so this PR closed.
When the external is exit span, the local span problem created and it has been fixed in the second commit.

I ran rabbitmq-scenario locally using run.sh. I saw few basic errors. 

is run.sh expected work locally for e.g. my laptop? I have docker installed.

> I ran rabbitmq-scenario locally using run.sh. I saw few basic errors.
> 
> is run.sh expected work locally for e.g. my laptop? I have docker installed.

Hello, has ```healthcheck-url``` been added? this is the log for [workload1-group1](https://builds.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/skywalking-agent-test/detail/skywalking-agent-test/1056/pipeline/166) because the failed due to a lack of ```healthcheck-url```.
```
[2019-11-07T01:30:10.520Z] [ERROR] rabbitmq-scenario-5.5.1 url=http://localhost:8080/rabbitmq-case/case/healthcheck, status=HTTP/1.1 404 
 health check failed!
```

Local error is not due to health check, it is complaining about missing or docker image permission. see below. 

Pulling rabbitmq-scenario-5.5.1-local (skywalking/agent-test-jvm:local)...
ERROR: The image for the service you're trying to recreate has been removed. If you continue, volume data could be lost. Consider backing up your data before continuing.

Anyway, I have added healthcheck and made changes to log messages. check

> Local error is not due to health check, it is complaining about missing or docker image permission. see below.
> 

Run locally use ```bash test/plugin/run.sh -f rabbitmq-scenario```
 
> Anyway, I have added healthcheck and made changes to log messages. check

Good, let's wait for the test result.

Todo list:
1. merge the master branch code
2. modify  ```Jenkinsfile-Agent-Test#Test Cases Report```
3. update  [The elapsed time list of plugins](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/Plugin-test.md#the-elapsed-time-list-of-plugins) according to test results
4. ...

@arugal That is the issue. run,sh is an issue. build_id has to be defaulted to latest so the built docker image can be run. It is defaulted to "local" because of this, docker compose generated looks for " skywalking/agent-test-jvm:local" that never exists and hence container not starting

I have shown the problem in bold below. check

build_id="**local**"
......
print_help() {
    echo  "Usage: run.sh [OPTION] SCENARIO_NAME"
    echo -e "\t-f, --force_build \t\t do force to build Plugin-Test tools and images"
    echo -e "\t--build_id, \t\t\t specify Plugin_Test's image tag. Defalt: **latest**"

ha,  use ```bash test/plugin/run.sh -f rabbitmq-scenario``` set the ```BUILD_ID```,  maybe you need to pull the latest code?

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/62060749f7bea3cd97716a5ba0cec6103f46d02c/test/plugin/run.sh#L148

Hi, @viswaramamoorthy  ~~I updated the default value of BUILD_ID without usage.~~ (I have a mistake. In fact, it has deleted.)
I have merged the master into your pr. Now, you need to pull the latest code. and retry it.
/run agent-plugin-test-4

I will supplement usage into the document.
we can get the usage by `./test/plugin/archetypes/generator.sh -h`.
so developers can try it if you are interested in it.
Few fixes added and all RabbitMQ tests are running successfully in local env
Related to #3583

Please follow this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/Plugin-test.md#the-elapsed-time-list-of-plugins. And add your task into the fastest one when it is ready to be merged.

> supported-list doc should be updated.

Regarding the supported version, the version before 6.7.0, some places are different, not compatible, and supports versions later than 6.7.1.
/run agent-plugin-test-1

@cyejing You could check the test at https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/webflux-scenario, and get the idea what is the difference.

@zhaoyuguang Maybe we just support part of it. I remember we just support webflux + Spring MVC, rather than real Reactive framework. You know better than me.
This is a very productive and helpful feature for new contributors. Great idea.
Ok, next will add comments and test the interceptors via mock.
NodeJS is not an official Apache repo. The issue is not managed here.

I mean we should modify our documents
SkyWalking supports to collect telemetry (traces and metrics) data from multiple sources and multiple formats, including
Java, .NET Core,  **NodeJS** and PHP auto-instrument agents in SkyWalking format
English only.

There is no ThreadLocal in NodeJS. It works for some cases already, we don't need to remove it from my understanding. If it isn't suitable for you, you could contribute, that is how open source project works.
